intro: Hieracium canonigrum, commonly known as the blackfoot hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and ragworts. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, and its leaves are typically lance-shaped with hairy surfaces. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas. The species is characterized by its dark-colored stems and is considered a perennial herb.
